title: Ethiopian ambassador discusses bilateral cooperation with Defence Secretary
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 30 (APP):Special Envoy and Ambassador Extraordinary of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, Dr. Jemal Beker Abdula met with Defence Secretary Lt. Gen (R) Muhammad Ali HI(M), to discuss bilateral and multilateral cooperation between the two countries.
The meeting reviewed the existing bilateral relationship, with both sides expressing mutual commitment to further strengthening these ties. Ambassador Dr. Jemal briefed the Defence Secretary on the significant reforms undertaken by Ethiopia under the leadership of Prime Minister H.E. Dr. Abiy Ahmed.
The Ambassador highlighted the renewed momentum in bilateral relations due to the establishment of the Ethiopian Embassy in Islamabad and the commencement of Ethiopian Airlines’ operations in Pakistan.
He also underscored Ethiopia’s strategic regional position and its contributions to peace and security.
The Defence Secretary commended Ethiopia’s homegrown economic reforms and reiterated Pakistan’s commitment to enhancing its relations with African nations, including Ethiopia.
He assured the Ambassador of his full support in advancing bilateral cooperation between the two countries.
